line_1: Of what he gives, unsparing and profuse,
line_2: That gratitude and temp'rance in our use

line_1: Thought is so rare, and fancy so profuse,
line_2: Digression is so much in modern use,

line_1: On either bank of dainty flowers profuse,
line_2: Whose teeming branches nectar'd fruits produce:

line_1: Misjudging wretch! while thou with hand profuse
line_2: And pour down riches on the vow'd recluse,

line_1: Where Ariconium pours her gems profuse,
line_2: Is not the red-streak's future juice

line_1: You show us, Rome was glorious, not profuse,
line_2: And pompous Buildings once were things of use.

line_1: Where lavish Nature strews her Gifts profuse,
line_2: Collect the Sweets that most delight the Muse.

line_1: Tho' rich, yet chaste; tho' splendid, not profuse;
line_2: Shows us magnificence allied to use;

line_1: Mod'rate in wealth, gen'rous but not profuse,
line_2: Well worthy riches, for he knew their use,
